3867E232341F4C2FA9A0DA2F7D1C09A4.description:
Identify and summarize information given through read-alouds or through other media about famous people of Tennessee:
  • David Crockett
  • Sequoyah
  • Andrew Jackson
  • James K. Polk
  • Andrew Johnson
  • Alvin C. York
  • Wilma Rudolph
  • Elvis Presley

BD042BB3848F43948AFFB719EF50EE92.description:
Participate in shared research projects to identify and describe the events or people celebrated during state and national holidays and why we celebrate them:
  • Martin Luther King, Jr. Day
  • Presidents' Day (George Washington and Abraham Lincoln)
  • Memorial Day
  • Independence Day
  • Columbus Day
  • Veterans' Day
  • Thanksgiving

7F247921DE4C406F862058DFBAF038AF.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several related events.

475A70F1F3B34F81894168F92E54577A.description: Scan historic photographs to gain information and arrange in sequential order.

D6FDF3FA81EE48ABB2DB3B1BF68DB45A.description: Locate and describe events on a calendar, including birthdays, holidays, cultural events, and school events.

7850A3CAC39648958F54C3CBE060F218.description: Identify days of the week and months of the year.

1D700CB1F92F4D8CBAFF4CBDD23509C1.description: Use correct words and phrases related to chronology and time (now, long ago, before, after; morning, afternoon, night; today, tomorrow, yesterday, last or next week, month, year; and present, past, and future tenses of verbs).

5A12DA48DAB24854A5C015EF1CA8F3AC.description: Identify sequential actions, including first, next, and last in stories and use them to describe personal experiences.

3A96A674B462404FA71F1A3AB01C75D1.description: Demonstrate good citizenship and identify characteristics of citizens of the United States as described in the Constitution.

5D02C79F117E4904B334C3EACD00CC4C.description: Explain the purpose of rules and laws.

A439DC18217448C68BF9BAB1284DA0CB.description: Identify roles of authority figures at home, at school, and in government to include parents, school principal, volunteers, police officers, fire and rescue workers, mayor, governor, and president.

C1D132279DC74E0F96C76C89B57EA33C.description: Use drawings, dictating, and writing to participate in shared research describing the role of the President.

7E46CB5319D942C9AF61DF4AABA21BC1.description: Recognize and name the current President of the United States.

26D406F5C7884E4B908884901F1C4C7F.description: Re-tell stories that illustrate honesty, courage, friendship, respect, responsibility and the wise or judicious exercise of authority, and explain how the characters in the stories show these qualities.

7A42F49715CF4DD6901D2ECEEDB9CE7A.description:
Identify the following state and national symbols:
  • The American flag and its colors and shapes
  • The Tennessee flag and its colors and shapes
  • The words of the Pledge of Allegiance
  • The Tennessee state flower (Iris) and bird (Mockingbird)
  • The national symbols of the bald eagle, Statue of Liberty, and the White House

4F1DFBC9A42543AFBEEC39C87A07E225.description: Give examples that show the meaning of the following concepts: authority, fairness, justice, responsibility, and rules.

6319ED2202DD4BE1A9D551F4F1DAB716.description: Locate Tennessee and the United States on a map.

094BFE70F7194AA1B55225B7ACA3EB84.description: Identify the student's street address, city/town, school name, and Tennessee as the state in which they live.

CDD19042D09848158FB25EE29FDF125D.description: Explain that a map is a drawing of a place to show where things are located and that a globe is a round model of the Earth.

4876112D941A476D8222D12A5FF3742D.description: Use correct words and phrases that indicate location and direction, including up, down, near, far, left, right, straight, back, in front of, and behind.

77A507682244441DB1A82058A4C0FB3E.description: Use words relating to work including wants, needs, jobs, money, buying and selling, in writing, drawing and conversation.

436D337934CB488EAE4562B2C1D0EA3D.description: Give examples of how family members, friends, and/or acquaintances use money directly or indirectly (cash, check or credit card) to make purchases.

33530B05EC1940BBB655FA8B16C34507.description: Explain why people work and recognize different types of jobs, including work done in the home, school, and community.

8B7E58082FE9463696C9E744CE7CE3E8.description: Explain the benefits of saving money.

2429DE5DD8AD4716AC824467DD9C47BA.description: Identify and explain how the basic human needs of food, clothing, shelter and transportation are met.

118D3B1C3AF1479483778F674DA5D2D4.description: Use diagrams to show similarities and differences in food, clothes, homes, games, and families in different cultures.

93AEFF4B61DF46458B3620DFA91A4653.description: Compare family traditions and customs among different cultures.

AF0594773A39418098CD5D5992357259.description: Summarize people and places referenced in picture books, stories, and real-life situations with supporting detail.

5EB4C6AB04F1483CA9BDCB49E259E92F.description: Describe familiar people, places, things and events, with clarifying detail about a student's home, school, and community.
